definition: to advertise for the owner of lost property
to recruit/to provoke/to beckon/to incur/to infect/contagious/a move (chess)/a maneuver/device/trick/to confess
neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc

sentences.english: I claimed my lost luggage at the Lost and Found.
sentences.chinese: 我在失物招领处认领了丢失的行李。

sentences.english: I suggest you go to the Lost and Found.
sentences.chinese: 我建议你去失物招领处看看。

sentences.english: We have checked our Lost and Found List, but I'm afraid your glasses did not appear on it .
sentences.chinese: 我已查过失物招领单，但您的眼镜恐怕并未记录在内。

sentences.english: Alan, Is that your computer game in the lost and found case?
sentences.chinese: 在失物招领箱里的那是你的电子游戏机吗？

sentences.english: There's a Lost and Found on this floor.
There's an orange pen in the lost and found case.
sentences.chinese: 失物招领箱里有一支橘黄色的钢笔。

sentences.english: Please look for it in the hotel lose-and-found office.
sentences.chinese: 请到宾馆的失物招领处寻找。

sentences.english: Our lost property departments really are treasure troves.
sentences.chinese: 我们的失物招领处简直就是一个宝库。

sentences.english: There are (hundreds of) things in the school Lost and Found Office.
sentences.chinese: 学校的失物招领处有数以百计的物品。

sentences.english: Please look for it in the hotel lost-and-found office.
sentences.chinese: 请到酒店失物招领处找找。

sentences.english: Does this building have a lost-and-found?
sentences.chinese: 这栋大楼有失物招领处吗？

sentences.english: This is Lost and Found. We've found your cell phone.
sentences.chinese: 这里是失物招领处，我们找到了您的手机。

sentences.english: Read the "Lost and Found", and write down the answers.
sentences.chinese: 阅读两则“失物”与“招领”广告，然后写出答语。

sentences.english: Have you been to the London Transport Lost Property Office in central London?
sentences.chinese: 你去过伦敦中心的伦敦交通系统失物招领处吗？

sentences.english: I claimed the my lost luggage at the Lost and Found.
sentences.chinese: 我在失物招领处认领了丢失的行李。

sentences.english: Is that your student ID card in the lost and found case?
sentences.chinese: 失物招领栏里是你的学生证吗？

definition: to claim (as one's property)/to adopt (a child)/to accept (an illegitimate child as one's own)
report the loss to the authorities concerned
owner of sth lost or stolen
to report the loss of something
lost/missing/to lose (sb in one's charge)/to get lost/to wander away/to lose (flavor, freshness, shape, hair, one's good looks etc)/to lose meaning (in translation)
to have sth stolen/to lose to theft/robbed
